wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Stewart McLardy (1867 – 1913) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a forward. He was part of the Abercorn side that won the Renfrewshire Challenge Cup and the Paisley Charity Cup in Season 1888–89, then joined Burnley in England's Football League, returning to Abercorn three years later. He was selected for the Scottish Football League XI and played in two international trials, but never gained a full cap for Scotland.
